CFSTRenD 0.9.0

    Create Animated Tree Ring Maps

    plot_mapping.Rd

    Generates animated GIF visualizations from tree ring data, with options to export various formats including PNG, GIF, CSV, and GeoTIFF files. The function creates annual maps showing tree ring patterns across the Canadian boreal forest region.

    plot_mapping(
  rast.lst,
  animation_fps = 1,
  rmd_output = FALSE,
  parms.out = NULL,
  dir.out = NULL,
  data.crs = "+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs",
  ...
)

    Arguments

    rast.lst

    A list object of class "cfs_gif" containing raster data for each species and year. Must be the output from the CFS_mapping() function.

    animation_fps

    Numeric. Frames per second for the animated GIF output. Default is 1.0.

    rmd_output

    Logical. If TRUE, saves GIF files to "rmd_gifs" directory in the current working directory for R Markdown display. Default is FALSE.

    parms.out

    Character vector. Specifies output formats to generate. Valid options are "csv", "tif", "png", "gif". If NULL (default), only returns the animated GIF objects in memory.

    dir.out

    Character string. Output directory path when parms.out is specified. Required if parms.out is not NULL. Directory will be created if it doesn't exist.

    data.crs

    Character string. Coordinate reference system for the input data. Default is "+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs".

    ...

    Additional arguments passed to the plot_tree_ring_map() function.

    Value

    A list of magick image objects containing animated GIFs, one for each species in the input data. List names correspond to species names. If parms.out is specified, files are also saved to disk in the specified formats.

    Details

    The function processes tree ring raster data through the following steps:

    • Applies Canadian boreal forest and provincial boundary masks

    • Creates annual maps using plot_tree_ring_map() function

    • Generates animated GIFs from the annual sequence

    • Optionally exports data in multiple formats (PNG, GIF, CSV, GeoTIFF)

    The function requires elevation data and boundary shapefiles that are included with the CFSTRenD package in the extdata/Mapping directory.

    For CSV output, the function creates wide-format tables with columns for grid_cell, X, Y coordinates, and annual values for each year.

    File Outputs

    When parms.out is specified, the following directory structure is created:

    • png/: Individual PNG files for each species and year

    • gif/: Animated GIF files for each species

    • csv/: CSV files with annual data for each species

    • tif/: GeoTIFF files for each species and year

    See also

    CFS_mapping for preparing input data

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic usage - return animated GIFs in memory
gif_results <- plot_mapping3(cfs_data)

# Generate all output formats
plot_mapping3(cfs_data,
              animation_fps = 2.0,
              parms.out = c("png", "gif", "csv"),
              dir.out = "output_folder")

# For R Markdown reports
plot_mapping3(cfs_data, rmd_output = TRUE)

# Custom animation speed and plot parameters
plot_mapping3(cfs_data,
              animation_fps = 0.5,
              parms.out = "gif",
              dir.out = "slow_gifs",
              color_palette = "viridis")
} # }
